description: Controls the layout of the tab picker UI that appears when choosing between open tabs. When enabled (true), tabs are displayed in a vertical list with rocket emoji indicators (ðŸš€) for non-active tabs. When disabled (false), tabs are displayed horizontally with constrained widths and inline rendering. This setting affects the presentation of tabs when the user invokes the tab selection command (e.g., pressing the key mapped to 'chooseTab'). The vertical layout is particularly useful for users with many open tabs, as it avoids horizontal overflow and provides a more scannable list format.

notes: This is a user-configurable setting that directly affects the visual presentation and layout of the tab picker interface. The vertical layout (when true) provides better usability for users with many tabs, while the horizontal layout (when false) is more compact. The setting is primarily used in the renderTabs function within the frontend module to control both CSS class assignment and element rendering logic. When verticalTabs is true, rocket emojis are added as visual indicators; when false, width constraints are applied to each tab element to fit them horizontally within the available window width.
